articles_4.title: Texas Pushes for State Control Over Carbon Capture Permitting
articles_4.summary: Texas industry groups have petitioned EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin to expedite the state's application for primary authority over carbon capture and storage projects. With 43 projects under review, Texas aims to become the fifth state with such authority, potentially contributing $1.8 billion to the state economy. Despite environmental concerns about underground CO2 storage risks, the initiative is supported by significant IRA tax credits of $85 per metric ton for CO2 storage.
articles_4.content: Texas oil, gas and industrial groups on Tuesday asked the new EPA administrator to speed up Texas' request to approve carbon capture and storage projects instead of the federal government, to help boost private investment and unleash capture technology...
